title: Game is in a perfect state
body: Can we stop criticizing the 100-0 /ff 15 meta? It makes LCS more interesting and it makes this game a greater expression of skill, in my personal opinion. Great work Riot Games! XD

replies.body:
League of legends is not a game made for watching, it is a game made for playing. Balancing it solely around LCS ruins it for almost everyone else because out of 10+ Millions of players only a few hundred are LCS players. 

You are literally saying screw 10 million players, it's only about the 200 or so best ones amongst them.

Everyone is entitled to their own opinions, and they shouldn't receive flak for sharing those opinions, whether they are positive or negative. Fwiw I appreciate the love (obviously I'm biased lol). A fresh meta is both scary and nerve racking, but also brings some fun and interesting shifts to the meta. I like how things have moved and hope to see more. Change will always cause fall out, but not change (IMO) is even worse.

> but not change (IMO) is even worse.

To an extent. Change to make things better is good, a lack of it is bad
Change for the sake of change, or just to make things different. Almost always makes things worse or at the very least, undesirable 

Also, what would your favorite meta be that we've had? For me it was post-sej nerf cinderhulk meta. Everyone had their place and everyone could be played practically anywhere. Was such a flexible and enjoyable time of this game

Thats hard for me to pin point cause for me it wasn't the meta that made the game fun, its the friends and memories lol. So a lot of my fav league memories are tied up in the events of what was happening rather than the meta X).

A large portion of us actually like the current state of the game that isn't pro play. I hands down stopped playing for the most of season 5 and 6 because it was awful but riot brought me back with the recent changes.
The problem with the current meta is that damage is absurd.  I disagree entirely with what Riot's done with League this year and I'm not sure I'll keep playing.

The problem with the current meta is that they're encouraging early game power and discouraging late game power, which means they've essentially made more than half the champions unplayable. 

When dev's are saying that games shouldn't last more than 30 min but then don't address the fact that they've made late game champions by design and nerfed them all because they're trying to ensure games end before anyone gets to late game... there kind of is a balance problem.

I don't mind that games go faster, but they should adjust the game so that more champions are viable because it's reducing the variety you see in the game. It's very easy to get repetitive and stale when the game revolves around a small set of champions.

at first I was really excited about LCS but now im growing a bit weary of seeing the same champ pools into week 2.
{{champion:8}} {{champion:36}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:266}} {{champion:164}}{{champion:5}}   {{champion:39}} every other game and then you know occasional {{champion:81}} {{champion:145}} {{champion:117}} .

more champs are pickable now sure but the power gap between "meta" and non-meta is still pretty big imo.
If Riot could actually tune down the overbearing picks and somehow find a way to make metaFORGING stronger than metaSLAVING I would be all aboard.

I really wish champions had much more sharper strengths and weaknesses because im tired of just generalist do-it-all's being first picked non stop then forcing out the same picks.
